speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: SCENE IV. Another part of the field.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Alarum. Excursions. Enter PRINCE HENRY, LORD JOHN OF LANCASTER, and EARL OF WESTMORELAND

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: I prithee,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Harry, withdraw thyself; thou bleed'st too much.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Lord John of Lancaster, go you with him.

speaker: LANCASTER
text_entry: Not I, my lord, unless I did bleed too.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I beseech your majesty, make up,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Lest your retirement do amaze your friends.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: I will do so.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: My Lord of Westmoreland, lead him to his tent.

speaker: WESTMORELAND
text_entry: Come, my lord, I'll lead you to your tent.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Lead me, my lord? I do not need your help:

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: And God forbid a shallow scratch should drive

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: The Prince of Wales from such a field as this,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Where stain'd nobility lies trodden on,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: and rebels' arms triumph in massacres!

speaker: LANCASTER
text_entry: We breathe too long: come, cousin Westmoreland,

speaker: LANCASTER
text_entry: Our duty this way lies; for God's sake come.

speaker: LANCASTER
text_entry: Exeunt LANCASTER and WESTMORELAND

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: By God, thou hast deceived me, Lancaster;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I did not think thee lord of such a spirit:

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Before, I loved thee as a brother, John;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: But now, I do respect thee as my soul.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: I saw him hold Lord Percy at the point

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: With lustier maintenance than I did look for

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Of such an ungrown warrior.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: O, this boy

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Lends mettle to us all!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Exit

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Enter DOUGLAS

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: Another king! they grow like Hydra's heads:

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: I am the Douglas, fatal to all those

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: That wear those colours on them: what art thou,

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: That counterfeit'st the person of a king?

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: The king himself; who, Douglas, grieves at heart

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: So many of his shadows thou hast met

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And not the very king. I have two boys

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Seek Percy and thyself about the field:

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: But, seeing thou fall'st on me so luckily,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: I will assay thee: so, defend thyself.

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: I fear thou art another counterfeit;

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: And yet, in faith, thou bear'st thee like a king:

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: But mine I am sure thou art, whoe'er thou be,

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: And thus I win thee.

speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
text_entry: They fight. KING HENRY being in danger, PRINCE HENRY enters

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Hold up thy head, vile Scot, or thou art like

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Never to hold it up again! the spirits

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Of valiant Shirley, Stafford, Blunt, are in my arms:

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: It is the Prince of Wales that threatens thee;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Who never promiseth but he means to pay.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: They fight: DOUGLAS flies

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Cheerly, my lord how fares your grace?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Sir Nicholas Gawsey hath for succor sent,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: And so hath Clifton: I'll to Clifton straight.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Stay, and breathe awhile:

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Thou hast redeem'd thy lost opinion,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: And show'd thou makest some tender of my life,

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: In this fair rescue thou hast brought to me.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: O God! they did me too much injury

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: That ever said I hearken'd for your death.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: If it were so, I might have let alone

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: The insulting hand of Douglas over you,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Which would have been as speedy in your end

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: As all the poisonous potions in the world

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: And saved the treacherous labour of your son.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Make up to Clifton: I'll to Sir Nicholas Gawsey.

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Exit

speaker: KING HENRY IV
text_entry: Enter HOTSPUR

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: If I mistake not, thou art Harry Monmouth.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Thou speak'st as if I would deny my name.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: My name is Harry Percy.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Why, then I see

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: A very valiant rebel of the name.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I am the Prince of Wales; and think not, Percy,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: To share with me in glory any more:

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Two stars keep not their motion in one sphere;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Nor can one England brook a double reign,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Of Harry Percy and the Prince of Wales.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Nor shall it, Harry; for the hour is come

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: To end the one of us; and would to God

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Thy name in arms were now as great as mine!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I'll make it greater ere I part from thee;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: And all the budding honours on thy crest

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I'll crop, to make a garland for my head.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: I can no longer brook thy vanities.

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: They fight

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Enter FALSTAFF

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Well said, Hal! to it Hal! Nay, you shall find no

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: boy's play here, I can tell you.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Re-enter DOUGLAS; he fights with FALSTAFF,  who falls down as if he were dead, and exit DOUGLAS. HOTSPUR is wounded, and falls

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: O, Harry, thou hast robb'd me of my youth!

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: I better brook the loss of brittle life

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Than those proud titles thou hast won of me;

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: They wound my thoughts worse than sword my flesh:

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: But thought's the slave of life, and life time's fool;

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And time, that takes survey of all the world,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Must have a stop. O, I could prophesy,

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: But that the earthy and cold hand of death

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Lies on my tongue: no, Percy, thou art dust

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: And food for--

speaker: HOTSPUR
text_entry: Dies

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: For worms, brave Percy: fare thee well, great heart!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Ill-weaved ambition, how much art thou shrunk!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: When that this body did contain a spirit,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: A kingdom for it was too small a bound;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: But now two paces of the vilest earth

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Is room enough: this earth that bears thee dead

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Bears not alive so stout a gentleman.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: If thou wert sensible of courtesy,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I should not make so dear a show of zeal:

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: But let my favours hide thy mangled face;

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: And, even in thy behalf, I'll thank myself

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: For doing these fair rites of tenderness.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Adieu, and take thy praise with thee to heaven!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Thy ignominy sleep with thee in the grave,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: But not remember'd in thy epitaph!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: He spieth FALSTAFF on the ground

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: What, old acquaintance! could not all this flesh

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Keep in a little life? Poor Jack, farewell!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I could have better spared a better man:

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: O, I should have a heavy miss of thee,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: If I were much in love with vanity!

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Death hath not struck so fat a deer to-day,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Though many dearer, in this bloody fray.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Embowell'd will I see thee by and by:

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Till then in blood by noble Percy lie.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Exit PRINCE HENRY

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: [Rising up]  Embowelled! if thou embowel me to-day,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I'll give you leave to powder me and eat me too

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: to-morrow. 'Sblood,'twas time to counterfeit, or

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: that hot termagant Scot had paid me scot and lot too.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Counterfeit? I lie, I am no counterfeit: to die,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: is to be a counterfeit; for he is but the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: counterfeit of a man who hath not the life of a man:

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: but to counterfeit dying, when a man thereby

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: liveth, is to be no counterfeit, but the true and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: perfect image of life indeed. The better part of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: valour is discretion; in the which better part I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: have saved my life.'Zounds, I am afraid of this

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: gunpowder Percy, though he be dead: how, if he

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: should counterfeit too and rise? by my faith, I am

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: afraid he would prove the better counterfeit.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Therefore I'll make him sure; yea, and I'll swear I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: killed him. Why may not he rise as well as I?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Nothing confutes me but eyes, and nobody sees me.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Therefore, sirrah,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Stabbing him

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: with a new wound in your thigh, come you along with me.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Takes up HOTSPUR on his back

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Re-enter PRINCE HENRY and LORD JOHN OF LANCASTER

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Come, brother John; full bravely hast thou flesh'd

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Thy maiden sword.

speaker: LANCASTER
text_entry: But, soft! whom have we here?

speaker: LANCASTER
text_entry: Did you not tell me this fat man was dead?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I did; I saw him dead,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Breathless and bleeding on the ground. Art

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: thou alive?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Or is it fantasy that plays upon our eyesight?

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I prithee, speak; we will not trust our eyes

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Without our ears: thou art not what thou seem'st.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: No, that's certain; I am not a double man: but if I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: be not Jack Falstaff, then am I a Jack. There is Percy:

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Throwing the body down

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: if your father will do me any honour, so; if not, let

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: him kill the next Percy himself. I look to be either

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: earl or duke, I can assure you.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Why, Percy I killed myself and saw thee dead.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Didst thou? Lord, Lord, how this world is given to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: lying! I grant you I was down and out of breath;

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: and so was he: but we rose both at an instant and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: fought a long hour by Shrewsbury clock. If I may be

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: believed, so; if not, let them that should reward

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: valour bear the sin upon their own heads. I'll take

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: it upon my death, I gave him this wound in the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: thigh: if the man were alive and would deny it,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: 'zounds, I would make him eat a piece of my sword.

speaker: LANCASTER
text_entry: This is the strangest tale that ever I heard.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: This is the strangest fellow, brother John.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Come, bring your luggage nobly on your back:

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: For my part, if a lie may do thee grace,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: I'll gild it with the happiest terms I have.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: A retreat is sounded

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: The trumpet sounds retreat; the day is ours.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Come, brother, let us to the highest of the field,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: To see what friends are living, who are dead.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
text_entry: Exeunt PRINCE HENRY and LANCASTER

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I'll follow, as they say, for reward. He that

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: rewards me, God reward him! If I do grow great,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: I'll grow less; for I'll purge, and leave sack, and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: live cleanly as a nobleman should do.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text_entry: Exit
